website_summaries.verdict: The Adidas Icon Trainer managed to meet the expectations of fitness enthusiasts when it came to its support, comfort, and performance as an all-around training shoe. There were those who pointed out the stylish design and quality build of the merchandise. However, there was an overwhelming amount of negative feedback due to the tight construction of its collar. Other than that, the shoe has been highly recommended.
pros: Numerous fitness aficionados commented that the Adidas Icon Trainer felt connected to their feet and provided a feeling of full-ground contact and stability
The mid-cut style delivered great lateral and ankle support which was found suitable for various workout sessions by many gym-goers
Plenty of users claimed that they liked the cushiony midsole
The style and the color options delighted multiple owners
A handful of reviewers commended its quality build
Some individuals praised the grippy outsole
cons: A vast majority of testers complained about the tight collar of the Icon trainer
others had to return it because it was too difficult to put on and remove, or caused chafing in the ankle

customer_reviews.title: Awful design
customer_reviews.text: By far the most poorly designed piece of footwear in the history of humans putting things on their feet. Tiny little opening to try and stuff my size 12's into and if you wear orthotics don't even dare to dream. Once they are on, and it took a shoe horn and a lot of grunting, their okay, but now I have to wear them for an entire year without ever taking them off because I don't have the time to go through that ordeal every single time! It is my sincere hope that the designer(s) of this shoe are somewhere else with a different job.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Badger

customer_reviews.title: If you like to curse when your frustrated... then these sneakers are for you!
customer_reviews.text: Although the shoes look great on me, the inner sock lining that substitutes for a tongue makes it almost impossible to put your foot in comfortably. There's almost no give in the sock where you can easily slide your foot in the sneaker. Too bad they couldn't have made a more flexible tongue then it would have gotten 5 stars..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: After one day of wearing the shoe, the jury is out if the shoes should be returned.
customer_reviews.text: This is a shoe that I have craved for. I fell in love with the design and found it very edgy. Unfortunately, it literally took 10 minutes to put both shoes on. No exaggeration on the difficulty and time. To add to my misery, my work day is 12 hours, door-to-door. And, my heel is killing me. Partly my fault for not having a sweat sock on but I do not think its an issue of running small. With that said, I look good but I am crying on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: This is my kid's 2nd pair of Adidas Turf shoes for baseball
customer_reviews.text: We bought a pair last year for a baseball tournament that did not allow metal spikes- turf shoes or molded cleats were allowed. He wore these and loved them. He has worn a ton and now outgrown them. He wanted the same shoe- only larger. Adidas has done it right with this shoe. He has now asked me to buy the closest version Adidas makes for basketball- for his winter conditioning program. Amazon and Adidas rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. Kind of hard to get on, but once on foot, comfortable and very durable. My son is hard on shoes, but these still look new after 6 months or so of wear!
customer_reviews.author: amanda vega

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting/wearing shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best fitting and wearing shoes I have ever owned. If there is anything negative to say it would be that they are somewhat difficult to put on which at first will make you think they're too small for you-they're not! It's just that the inner elastic liner needs to be opened up as you slide your foot in. This is part of what makes these shoes wear like they do and grip the ankles for superior support. The shoes are excellent for performing exercises which is all I bought them for-to exercise inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: Facetwice

customer_reviews.title: SHOEHORN  !!!
customer_reviews.text: LLLike a glove! Fits nice and snug. Becomes part of your foot ,and looks great! Only downsides are -the toe box is a little long. My size 10 fits great on sides and back , but front still has about half an inch beyond my big toe. And pack a small inexpensive shoe horn in your gym bag. Really.
customer_reviews.author: Miko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Worst sneaker I have ever purchased, this sneaker has some weird fitted sock insert that makes the shoe literally impossible to get on. The struggle was real with this one, I put up with it for a few weeks and gave them away
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: TIGHT... GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes the shoes. They were EXTREMELY hard to get on the first few times but he's finally got them stretched enough that he can do it. Because of the great price,I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE

customer_reviews.title: Small opening.
customer_reviews.text: This “sneaker” is impossible to get on without a shoehorn if you have even slightly wide feet. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the shoe is hard to put your foot in, but it's definitely possible if you loosen up the laces as much as possible. They should stretch later on, but they provide good support the way they're designed. 8/10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and great construction., but it was too small for me. I have a hgh arch. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: A struggle
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look cool but I wish I read the other reviews about how it takes a solid 3 minutes to get each shoe on your foot. And it’s an aggressive 3 minutes to shove your foot in a hole that it can’t fit in. Not worth the look. Ps. It’s just as hard to take them off as to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Horrible shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have inner built-in sock with a supper small opening. It makes impossible to put the shoes on. Also the outside of the shoes is pretty cheap plastic like material.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Way too small and tight. I'm not sure how ...
customer_reviews.text: Way too small and tight. I'm not sure how tight they are designed to be, but they hurt! So, they were returned.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get them on your feet. It would seem that the engineers at Adidas didn’t even bother to try on their own creation. Do not buy the shoes, you will not be able to get them on your feet. An absolute joke.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best running sneaker I ever ran in and they look fashionable as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are impossible to get on my sons feet.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Livingston

customer_reviews.title: This shoe has flat bottom like a basketball shoe
customer_reviews.text: The write up selling advertised was freak x carbon baseball shoe. Grips well on turf. This shoe has flat bottom like a basketball shoe. Shoe is not what I expected but the side view of advertised picture mislead me to think it was wht I needed. I must return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they have like a double lining
customer_reviews.text: Went up a whole size, they have like a double lining, really sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jones boy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on foot
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice shoe. Because of it being a slip on, the opening was too tight. It was a struggle getting on. Order a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoe ran smaller than what I wear. Could not get my foot in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: A. Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, great looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe for training and the amount of support it offers during any exercise has been fantastic. I would highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Santangelo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Snug fit but holds up well and provides good ankle support
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Super tight Elastic
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get my foot in thru the elastic portion of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: sean shaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe but waaaay to difficult to get on
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 12 and the opening of this shoe is so small, I couldn't get my size 12 foot through the opening. Nice looking shoe but waaaay to difficult to get on. Shame!
customer_reviews.author: BLAKE

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love you can use them indoors also without ruining wood floors!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit
customer_reviews.text: Can’t even get shoe on my foot. Returning without wearing.
customer_reviews.author: sean kenneally

customer_reviews.title: Built-in sock punish
customer_reviews.text: Because of built-in socks it is impossible to put in, although tried 1-size up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hagz.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and light... use them a lot for cross training...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support and stability
customer_reviews.text: This Shoe really cradles your heal. I thought it felt weird at first, and did not like it. I thought I’d try it through a workout any ways. I ended up loving it’s support! I love shoe now. It’s a bit tight to put on because of the cloth/sock edge at the top of the shoe, but it’s now my favorite cross training shoe!
customer_reviews.author: always working at it

customer_reviews.title: I received second hand shoes
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the shoes to be brand new. Unfortunately one of them came already used with a spot of dirt as you can appreciate on the pictures. Now I only keep thinking if it has been used for training already.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Disla

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoe fits a little snug but for what workouts I do at F45 it is great. Not easy to get over my heel but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Stigs

product_meta.title: adidas Mens Icon Trainer Hight Top Lace Up Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: These men's training shoes pair a seamless mesh upper with an outsole that delivers solid traction on turf. Made of breathable mesh, the upper is reinforced with print overlays for abrasion resistance and strategic support.
feature_bullets: Internal bootee construction for extra ankle support
Haptic print overlay on upper provides seamless support where you need it
Durable overlays for abrasion protection and lightweight, flexible support
Multi-sport trainer with lacrosse and football crossover uses
